name: seven-server
description: Seven's Node.js app, packaged for Heroku

BOT_TOKEN.description: Your Discord bot credential, acquired from the Developer Portal.

HTB_TOKEN.description: The legacy (V3) HTB API token (turn on legacy interface to get this)

HTB_EMAIL.description: Your Hack The Box login email address.

HTB_PASS.description: Your personal Hack The Box password (consider resetting this to a secure random one, for bot usage)

HTB_V4_TOKEN.description: The new (V4) App Token (generate one in your profile settings)

GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS.description: The JSON credential file from GCP for the DialogFlow project's API user, as a string.

GOOGLE_CLOUD_PROJECT.description: The short name / tag that uniquely identifies your DialogFlow project on GCP, e.g. 'seven-huqce'.

ADMIN_DISCORD_IDS.description: The IDs of the Discord user who will have administrator access to the bot (probably you!). A JSON array of Discord ID strings.

CAPTAIN_DISCORD_IDS.description: The IDs of the Discord user who will have captain-level access to the bot (probably you!). A JSON array of Discord ID strings.

DISCORD_GUILD_ID.description: The HTB Team's Discord guild ID.

DISCORD_ANNOUNCE_CHAN_ID.description: The ID of the channel (e.g. 'bot') where Seven can send notifications. (Omit if announcements are not desired)

EMOJI_GUILD_ID.description: The ID of the Guild (e.g. 'Seven-Emoji') which Seven can use for storing and retrieving custom emoji.
